trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem"></xref> objects, and is used to hold the items of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List"></xref> control and a <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList"></xref> control.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

Accessing the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List.Items%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List> control or the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList.Items%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList> control retrieves a MobileListItemCollection object.
You can add or remove items from the collection at run time.
A MobileListItemCollection object inherits from the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItemCollection"></xref> class.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItemCollection"></xref> class using the provided array.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
You can use this version of the constructor syntax to populate the new object with the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItemCollection> objects contained in the `items` parameter.
An array that contains a list of <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem"></xref> objects.
Adds an item to the end of a collection with the provided string as the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Text*> property.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Creates a new list item with the specified text and then adds it to the end of the collection.
The item to add to the end of the collection.
Adds an item to the end of a collection.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

Depending on the syntax used, the Add method either adds the specified item to the end of the collection, or constructs a new list item with the specified text and then adds it to the end of the collection.
The item to add to the end of the collection.
Clears the collection.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method is not available in the read-only <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IObjectListFieldCollection> interface.
You can use the Clear method for all the classes where this method applies.

For example, the Clear method for a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet> collection clears all the styles in the collection; or for the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.DeviceSpecificChoiceCollection>, it clears all the choices in the collection.
Adding a field to the fields of an object list changes the data-binding behavior of the control, and requires you to bind data to the control again.
Gets a value indicating whether the given item is contained in the collection.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The item to search for.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the given item is contained in the collection; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the items in the specified collection as a single array of <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem"></xref> objects.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
An array of the items in the specified collection.
Gets the index of the specified item in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItemCollection"></xref> object.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Gets the index of the specified item as an integer.
If the specified item is not in the collection, the IndexOf method returns `-1`.
An item to search for in the collection.
The index of the specified item in the collection.
Adds an item to the specified location in the collection.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The `index` value must be between 0 and the size of the collection.
If `index` is the size of the collection, `item` is added to the end of the collection.
This overload first creates a new <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem> object with the given string, and inserts this item.
The index.
The item to be inserted into the list.
Adds an item to the specified location in the collection.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The `index` value must be between 0 and the size of the collection.
If `index` is the size of the collection, `item` is added to the end of the collection.
The index.
The item to be inserted into the list.
Gets a value indicating whether the collection is tracking changes to view state.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if tracking view state changes; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem"></xref> item in the collection by index.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The index of the item to retrieve.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem"></xref> item at the specified index.
Loads the collection's previously saved view state.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The object containing the view-state information to be loaded.
Removes the item with the specified value.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The value of the item to remove.
The first item that matches this value in the collection is removed.
Removes the item with the specified value.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The value of the item to remove.
The first item that matches this value in the collection is removed.
Removes the item at the specified index.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The index number of the item to remove.
Saves the changes to a server control's view state to a <xref:System.Object>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
A <xref:System.Object> that contains the view-state information.
Sets the array of <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem"></xref> objects as the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItemCollection"></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem"></xref> array.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager.IsTrackingViewState%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager> interface.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem"></xref> object is tracking its view-state changes; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager.LoadViewState%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager> interface.
The object containing the view state information to be loaded.
the view state data has been modified or corrupted.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager.SaveViewState%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager> interface.
The view-state changes for the control.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager.TrackViewState%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager> interface.
Instructs the collection to track changes to its view state.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
After this method has been called, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItemCollection.IsTrackingViewState%2A> property will return `true`.

Also, the <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager.IsTrackingViewState%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager> objects in the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItemCollection> will be set to `true`.
